page.title: 19TRULY RURAL PERSON (cont)
page.content: There have been significant changes in social attitudes and class differences.The local aristocracy had the monopoly of land, employees, thus power and received the salute from the local community. Employees were afraid of losing jobs and obeyed the employer at all costs. The Minister and Teacher would be saluted by members of the community but the war diminished this custom which can still be seen today when a man raises his hat to a woman. {School Customs}- Educationally there have been changes. Pupils were mainly from ploughmans families while today there is a greater social mixture - professional, artistic, farming. Some families who work in St. Andrews chose to live in Dunino. there were 60 pupils in the school - 30 in each class when Mrs. McCreadie was a pupil but today there are 19 in all.
